articles.title: Patrik Winiger, PhD
articles.contents:
Macromolecular Aerosols Lab
          
          
          Home
          About
          Projects
          Publications
          Contact
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Patrik Winiger, PhD
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Research Interest
            I am interested in short-lived climate pollutants, their
            sources, effects on climate, health impacts, and potential
            mitigation pathways. This includes not only combustion
            products, but also other light absorbing aerosols and
            impurities in snow and ice; like algae, bacteria, dust,
            soot, or polymers. In short: macromolecules
            
            
            Research projects
            MACrAA - Macromolecular aerosols in the cryosphere from
            the Arctic to the Alps
            
            
            Expericence and Education
            Project leader GIS modelling, Stadt Zürich, Air Quality
            Department, 2021-2022
            Grant Advisor and Project Manager, ETH Zürich,
            EUGrantsAccess, 2018-2021
            Postdoc, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Earth and Climate
            unit, 2018-2019
            PhD Student, Stockholm university, Department of Applied
            Sciences and Analytical Chemistry, 2011-2017
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Patrik Winiger, PhD
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                    
                  
                                  
              
            
            
              
              Research Interest
              I am interested in short-lived climate pollutants,
              their sources, effects on climate, health impacts, and
              potential mitigation pathways. This includes not only
              combustion products, but also other light absorbing
              aerosols and impurities in snow and ice; like algae,
              bacteria, dust, soot, or polymers. In short:
              macromolecules
              
              
              Research projects
              MACrAA - Macromolecular aerosols in the cryosphere
              from the Arctic to the Alps
              
              
              Expericence and Education
              Project leader GIS modelling, Stadt Zürich, Air
              Quality Department, 2021-2022
              Grant Advisor and Project Manager, ETH Zürich,
              EUGrantsAccess, 2018-2021
              Postdoc, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Earth and
              Climate unit, 2018-2019
              PhD Student, Stockholm university, Department of
              Applied Sciences and Analytical Chemistry, 2011-2017
